content.description: This is a nice, technical problem that is short enough to boulder safely. Footwork intensive. Called "Sleepathon" in the Hellweg/Warstler guidebook.
content.location: Right-hand face of the right-hand boulder

content.description: A quintessential Rubidoux slab, made more exciting if approached as a highball boulder problem and without dodging over to the arete too early. The old Hellweg/Warstler guide (that most everyone disliked) claims there are two distinct 5.10 routes on this boulder. The Fry guide probably gives a better description by stating that "many variations are possible." A good slab to play around on and develop that footwork.
content.protection: Crashpads or toprope (kinda tricky to set up as I recall)
content.location: The left of three triangle or wedge-shaped boulders

content.description: Start with your right hand on a good, but sharp, shallow pocket, left hand high on a crimp.   Pull on step up high and slap for the gritty sloper, match then mantle on up.
content.location:
On a boulder to the right of

Triangulation

.

content.description: Climb the short mottle colored wall via a right slanting crack.
content.location: On the right (facing out) of the approach path.

content.description: Climb up and grab the arete and then romp all the way to the top of the slab.
content.location: Left arete of the left slab

content.description: Climb the right arete of the slab until 2/3 height when an exciting lieback gains the top.
content.location: Right arete of the left slab

content.description: Climb the left arete of the slab up and right as it nears the apex of the slab.
content.location: Left arete of right triangular slab

content.description: Climb up the left of the slab directly with good positive holds.
content.location: Left side of right triangular shaped slab

content.description:
Start at

Problem D

on the left and make a fingery traverse across

Triangle Face

, and then into the wide crack and around the nose of

Isosceles

.  Continue rightwards to a final tricky section to reach the arete on the right of

Triangulation

.
content.location: Left to Right girdle of the boulders

content.description:
This problem climbs the striking middle Arete of the boulders.

Start up the slabby arete, until the ledge at 2/3 height is reached.

From the ledge make very committing moves up the arete (easier if facing right).

The crux is at the top, and its a long way up there with a nasty landing.
